basic_data.name: Courtyard by Marriott Toronto Downtown
basic_data.priceRange: $$ (Based on Average Nightly Rates for a Standard Room from our Partners)

description: Expect a relaxing stay at Courtyard Toronto Downtown. Our Toronto, Ontario, hotel is near downtown destinations like Dundas Square, the Village, CN Tower, Eaton Centre and the University of Toronto's St. George campus. After a day spent discovering Toronto's landmarks, relax in stylish accommodations featuring mini-fridges, sleek work desks and free Wi-Fi. Othe hotel amenities include a fitness centre and an on-site American restaurant.
featues: Fitness Center with Gym / Workout Room

reviews.title: Spacious Rooms
reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed in this hotel in Downtown Toronto.The layout of this hotel hasn't really changed much since we stayed here over 10 years ago. They probably have changed the furniture but the location of the breakfast area, the lobby and the small store was still the same. The rooms has definitely been renovated with the standard Courtyard coloured wallpaper and new carpets. Courtyard definitely has one of the bigger hotel rooms in downtown Toronto.The rooms are equipped with an iron/ironing board, a small refrigerator and safe a huge TV and the bathroom amenities are already in wall mounted dispensers.Their breakfast is quite extensive with 4 choices of meals and they are reasonably priced.As Marriot Goldcard members we were given a welcome bag which contained a bottle of water,a can of Perrier water and Pretzels.There was a slight problem when we reached our room and the room card was not working. They said it was a programming error with the room so someone came up to re program our door.The location of this hotel right smack in Yonge Street in Downtown Toronto is its major advantage with easy access to the subway and walking distance to Eaton Centre.

reviews.title: Loved our stay!
reviews.text: We had a wonderful, pleasant, enjoyable 6 nights stay at this hotel from August 21-27, 2021. After I booked our stay in June, I had a few concerns. Each time I called the hotel, I heard a pleasant voice and addressing me by my last name. The hotel has a good security system that is, you need to swipe your room key to get in to the hotel. The room that we got was located in the south wing, on the eighth floor, a bit close to the elevator. (North wing was not opened) Sometimes, I could hear noises. Talking about the elevators. There were three and a "working" elevator. It seemed to us that the middle elevator of the three, was the one that "worked" the most and sometimes made squeaky sounds. During one of the days that we were there, this elevator was under maintenance!  Room itself was clean, and spacious enough with many amenities except a microwave. As it's still under the pandemic, front desk staff did tell me when we checked in that the hotel's policy is to do housekeeping every 3rd day. We chose not to have housekeeping as we felt this was safer. Every evening when we came back, we would ask front desk for more towels, tea/coffee, etc. Sometimes, we got them in plastic bags and other times, we got them sent to the room. As our flight back to Vancouver, BC, was in the evening at 10:15pm, the hotel granted us a late check out at 2pm with free luggage storage. If we wished to keep the room till around 6/7pm, we'd have to pay C$100. After check out, we sat in the lobby till it was time to go to the airport. When we had to go out to buy drinks, upon returning to the hotel, we didn't have a room key to swipe, we could push the button and the front desk would open the door. During our 13 days in Ontario, we'd stayed in 5 different hotels, and this is the second best hotel. This hotel is highly recommended by us because the location is perfect, close to College subway, and walking distance to many places. Staff are extremely friendly and polite, very professional.

reviews.title: Brilliant stay for quarantine arrival
reviews.text: Professional and friendly service. Excellent COVID precautions in place. Our room was super clean.All meals included in the package. Limited choice but both the vegetarian and meat meals were really tasty!Very prompt delivery of additional shampoos, coffee etcLarge car park, pretty deserted made for a good walking/fresh air breakClear guidance from staff to ensure everyone stayed safe.Quiet room, no construction works going on as mentioned at other venuesHighly recommended

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: I stayed at this property for one night while on business. Unfortunately, they under delivered to a loyal Bonvoy member.  The lady who checked me in made no mention of my platinum status. When I asked her for breakfast for my platinum amenity, she indicated they don’t offer a breakfast at this property?  For the first time in over 2 years, I didn’t get a room upgrade. Not a huge deal because I was only in the room for 8 hours, but when you get accustomed to certain corporate standards, you definitely notice when they fail to deliver. The room itself was dark and the bathroom had paint peeling off the ceiling. Very underwhelming. Valet parking was $45 day.  The bed was comfortable and it was nice to have a couple pillows with a little more substance.  The location is convenient to College Park, but there is construction going on just north of the hotel and the noise began around 6:30 am. Overall, I regret not staying at the Sheraton Centre. It is a little further away, but acknowledges their platinum guests and has a nice Club Lounge.

reviews.title: Meh!
reviews.text: I'm always suspicious when I see hotels that have their carpets and walls decorated in the colors of dirt. When dirt blends in with the carpet it's less noticeable. That is, unless you take a closer look.The location of this hotel is convenient for our purposes, so we booked it for 7 nights. The experience at the helpdesk was rater vapid, nothing out of the ordinary. The staff wasn't rude, but wasn't friendly either, just all business. That was the tone of our entire stay. The rooms are cleaned every other day, with minimum or no attention to details, poorly made beds, just surface-level cleaning. They keep things clean enough, but not spotless. Seems like they also clean the hallways every other day. I saw leftover food from another room in the hallway floor for 2 days. I took a picture of it and went to the front desk to tell them to please remove it.The hotel is located in the downtown area, so it's not their fault that there is noise outside; they have no control over what happens outside their property. However, they are in complete control over how they keep their facilities and how they address their guests, which is why I am giving this review. The facilities are not necessarily run down, but they are kept to a minimum. You can see dirt accumulated in common areas and in the room. The elevators are barely functional, and we spotted a mouse or two in the lobby area.As much as I want to be understanding that the global pandemic greatly impacted the hospitality industry, and as much as I understand that sometimes business need to cut corners to stay afloat, this is different. Dirt, barely functional facilities and mice take this hotel to a place of neglect, not just survival.

reviews.title: Great choice in city centre
reviews.text: Courtyard has a great location, with most of central Toronto within walking distance. Although clearly an older property, my South Tower room was pleasantly decorated and a decent size, with a huge flat-screen TV and drip coffee maker. The bathroom layout was a little strange, with the wash basin completely separate from the bath and toilet, in a separate area with the closet. I didn’t have any issues with noise and I found the room heating/cooling responsive and easy to control.Breakfast was from a menu in the Bistro café on lobby level. Service was friendly and the food fresh and tasty. Starbucks coffee was excellent. The restaurant was only operational for breakfast but some drinks and light snacks (including home-made sandwiches) could be purchased at other times, day and night.I appreciated the complimentary laundry facility, which had large professional standard washers and dryers available, and even free washing liquid provided.The staff I interacted with were all extremely friendly and helpful. They made me feel very welcome and ensured a pleasant stay. I would particularly recognise Pauline from the house-keeping team, who kept my room spotless and well stocked.As Bonvoy Gold I was given a bag of complimentary snacks at check in, but no room upgrade was offered.This is not a luxury hotel, but a comfortable and friendly base for visitors to Toronto. Recommended

reviews.title: quick toronto downtown trip
reviews.text: Great location. We had a busy schedule downtown Toronto ranging from Queen's Park to Union Station, in and around Bay, Yonge and University. We were able to comfortably walk anywhere from this hotel. Deal was as good or better than anyother comparable hotel in the vicinity. We asked for and received a quiet room on a high floor with a window that could be opened for fresh air. Room was clean and well maintained, basically a perfect mid price location for a quick trip and peaceful night's rest.

reviews.title: A pleasant experience
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for four nights while I was in Toronto having surgery. Because I was on a liquid diet I was only able to eat broth at that the time. The only real issue I had with the hotel was that there were no microwaves in the room I had to take my food down to the lobby and heat it up. The rooms were very clean however there was a bit of a musty odour but that may be because it hasn't been used much during the pandemic. The staff were excellent and accommodating. They put us on the lowest level possible so I would be close to the elevator in case I had an emergency.  We also received complimentary parking. Unfortunately pool and fitness are and Bistro were not open during to the pandemic. Overall we were pleased. Location is perfect.

reviews.title: Decent location and facilities
reviews.text: The hotel is location 1 street from Yonge station which is approximately a 10 minute walk to the Eaton centre and 25-30 minutes from the Scotiabank Arena and CN tower. The prices were reasonable and the hotel staff friendly. Comfortable room with good facilities as well as being clean and tidy.

reviews.title: Great hotel and location
reviews.text: My husband always used to stay at this hotel for work, so when we were picking a hotel for vacation we chose this one. The room rate was very reasonable for Toronto in July, the staff were very friendly very helpful, and when we were placed on a lower floor near an elevator they quickly put us in a room away from an elevator upon request. Our room was very clean and very quiet we were very happy with our experience here and would stay here again.

reviews.title: Lovely breakfast
reviews.text: Just a busy morning and quickly checked out to grab a breakfast and get going on my new job! The staff at the breakfast cafe was so nice. The server was very polite and understanding and helped enhance my experience so much. I don’t remember name correctly but guess it was Shubnam. Wonderful work team. The front office staff was also nice and lovely housekeeping team. Will sure visit again.

reviews.title: Enjoyable Visit
reviews.text: I was here on a 4 night stay and was very pleased with the central location.Staff were incredibly helpful and friendly especially Nihal, at the front desk, who was professionalism personified. A genuine credit to the organisation. The car valet employee was incredibly helpful and was able to give me directions and recommendations for a good Chinese restaurant on Yonge St. The rooms were well appointed and clean with tea and coffee facilities along with other amenities to be expected from a quality chain hotel.I used the gym daily and it, too, was also well appointed with all necessary equipment for a short stay session.The only thing I did miss was a pool, sauna and steam room. These would have made the stay even more enjoyable. I understand there used to be a pool pre-COVID but this was closed and not reopened. Probably worth considering re-opening it as it adds to the experience. All told, a good stay without any complaints.

reviews.title: Great hotel in a convenient, central location.
reviews.text: Great hotel in a good location for central Toronto (around a 10-minute walk to Union Station, a couple of minutes walk from the main Hop on-Hop Off bus) and around a 15-minute walk to the waterfront)..... and two minute's walk from Fran's Diner! A superb place for a traditional Canadian breakfast.The hotel is mid-market with all the usual facilities needed. Very nice, good-sized room for a central city hotel with everything spotlessly clean.So why not five stars?Just a couple of small issues:The breakfast selection is limited as the food area is more of a cafe than a full service restaurant (we didn't try dinner so unable to review)The bathroom in the bedroom was split into two.  One room had toilet, bath and shower while the sink was in a separate open area on the other side of the room. Very strange as this means that every time you use the bathroom you then have to walk across the bedroom (turn on the light over the sink if at night) to wash your hands etc.  Inconvenient and disturbing for your partner if the bathroom is needed during the night!But overall an enjoyable stay :)

reviews.title: Too many chances to make it right!
reviews.text: This hotel is incredibly frustrating, I have told countless colleagues and friends about the incredible restaurant on premise, both food and especially the team (I have told them countless times the restaurant is higher than the hotel.  The hotel is older, and I can forgive worn furniture and rugs, but I cannot ignore rudeness.  I have stayed there on every stay in Toronto since October of 2022, i have very specific health needs because of leg issues, I have asked them specifically for additional items in the room verbally and through their app.  I always am assured i will get what I need, but rarely do.  In addition to this, on my last stay, I was having breakfast at 745AM (I needed to return to my room by 8 for a work call) there was an event going on that weekend in Toronto and the hotel created an odd policy of wearing a wristband.  They are welcome to do whatever they want, however, since I was checking out after my call I didn’t see a need to put that wrist band on for 15 minutes, these types of bands will irritate my skin within minutes.  I told their assistant manager that I was only going to be in the restaurant for 15 minutes then checking out in an hour, he insisted (stared me down) that I “must put the band on”, I explained I would be leaving in a hour or so and he wouldn’t give it up.  I asked for my food to go and ate in my room.  I watched him bully other guests (while they had food in their mouth) to put their band on.  Again, whatever policy they have is their business, and if a guest doesn’t like it they can stay somewhere else.  I, however do not need to be harassed while trying to have a quick breakfast and checking out within an hour to put the band on.  I told the front desk assistant manager that I needed a note from a senior manager as to whether or not they want me to stay at their hotel and if they would be able to support my needs, all I received was a note from the same assistant front desk manager.  I have since canceled two reservations and am staying elsewhere in Toronto.  If the hotel GM can’t find time in their day to send a quick email to a lifetime Titanium guest with ongoing issues, then i can understand why the service levels are so low.

reviews.title: Great central hotel in toronto
reviews.text: Good hotel in a great central spot, welcoming, and helpful staff, and a clean and spacious room.  Good sized bathrooms but no free water in the rooms which was a shame after a long travel in. Overall would recommender nd would be happy to stay again

reviews.title: Good Hotel, Poor location
reviews.text: Nice, if corporate, hotel but it looked tired. The room was OK and quiet, on the 2nd floor but fridge could have been bigger. The breakfast in the Bistro was good and and they had gluten free options. Staff were friendly.No visible concierge service and no local information available.It's the area it sits in that lets this hotel down. You're near a subway station but there are no restaurants nearby only take aways or fast food outlets. There was a distinct smell of cannabis and urine between the hotel and the subway, not what you want when travelling with children.

reviews.title: Barn door Marriott Courtyard locks wife in bathroom
reviews.text: I had a choice between Hilton Doubletree on Chestnut or the Marriott Courtyard on Yonge.  I chose the latter.  What a mistake once you get past the front desk which was very good.  We arrived at 11:30pm, after yet another delayed Air Canada flight.   Worst Marriott room I have ever had.  Pillows were so stiff I had to sleep without one.  Room was very small.  The design of the room was so tortured it should be left as an overnight for the manager.  The worst thing was the bathroom door.  It was a small barn door on rollers that did not work.  My esposa was trapped in the bathroom had I not been there to wrestle the thing open.  I put the door rollers back on the bar, yet the same thing happened to me.  I managed to squeeze thru the 6" I was able to push/pull it open.  Large gaps between the door and the walls insure not a lot of privacy.  On top of all that the room was almost double the cost of the Doubletree I moved to after one night.  By contrast, the Doubletree is a beautiful room, much more luxurious bedding and pillows and furnishings.  And best of all a normal bathroom door !!  If the two brands were ever equal, the Doubletree has long since left the Courtyard in the dust.

reviews.title: No service
reviews.text: Aweful service, they don't even answer the phone, there's simply a bot that directs you to a voicemail box. You leave there your request and your phone number and you're NEVER called back. I've been waiting in my mailbox for almost a montyh for the invoice they promised would be there, and am still waiting. Lots of much better hotels around, never going back there.

reviews.title: Problem with debit card
reviews.text: Had a precooked and paid for room at this hotel via a travel agent,  and when we arrived at 10pm local time they informed me that my debit card was not acceptable as a deposit for the room As a traveller from the UK we don't need or use a credit card,  the travel agent did not inform us debit cards were not suitable,  and basically we would have been without board for the night in spite of prebooking and paying for the room, the desk agent said no credit card no stay,  unless we could provide a credit card. We had stayed at several hotels in Canada and a cruise to Alaska using our debit card s a deposit without problem.  I found the attitude and inflexibility of the reception staff unacceptable. I offered cash and debit card but both were unacceptable, it was only that our travel companions were able to offer a credit card on our behalf we were able to stay in our paid for and precooked room. Reception staff quoted their website terms and conditions,  but we had the room booked by an agent.  And had not seen these terms.  I was made to feel like a second class citizen, I've stayed at hotels all over the world on my debit card without problem,   poor show Marriot.

reviews.title: Comfortable but pretty average
reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights at the start of an extesive Canadian tour.  Room was quiet and clean and the bed was comfortable.  The bistro food was pretty good but, overall, this was a pretty average hotel.  There are plenty takeaways nearby but you need to go in towards the centre to find any restaurants worth a mention.  Signage around the area suggested that a redevelopment of the site was on the cards with the hotel being replaced by a couple of blocks of apartments.  That may help explain the feeling we got of the hotel being a bit "run down".

reviews.title: Perfect all round
reviews.text: Stayed here for a night and it was a very pleasant stay. The staff are very polite and they had did everything possible to keep the place germ free during the pandemic. I cannot fault the place. There was a homeless guy who got into the hotel via the back door, he was soon taken care of. Staff were on top of everything and very helpful. Beds were very comfortable and we had a great night sleep.

reviews.title: A Lovely Hotel to visit in Downtown Toronto.
reviews.text: Marriott Courtyard Downtown Toronto is a must visit hotel as it offers very good services throughout your stay. All the amenities they provide were very well maintained and the staff there is really great. They will make you feel like you are in your own home and will never let never let you down in any type of service they offer. You just have to ask for night slippers as we usually don't get in our room and we have to ask for them from any room attendant to bring a pair of it. The food they offer is really amazing. Rooms they provide are also well maintained with best hygiene and best scenic views and the staff will interact with you every time they see you and make you stay the best one so far.

reviews.title: Clean hotel just north of downtown core with decent room rates
reviews.text: The hotel has been there for many years under different brands, but the location is interesting as it is not in the core near Eaton center, but it is better priced for being 1 km north.  The surrounding area of the hotel has residential apartments.  It is not high end neighbourhood.The room was clean and large enough for an overnight stay.  Good sized fitness room with enough equipment for a work out.  Didn't try the pool. It was convenient for my meetings in the city.  I was able to walk or take a short uber ride.

reviews.title: A decent hotel in a great location
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is tough to beat as it was convenient to so much of what we wanted to do in Toronto. The price was fairly reasonable as well but it didn’t feel like we got a lot of value in the room itself beyond the bed being comfortable and the balcony having a nice view. The room showed some signs of heavy wear including a crack in the sink. Also didn’t help that even though a sheet said the room was serviced the day before we arrived but the shower promptly ran out of soap and lotion had to be requested from the front desk rather than being available upon arrival like most other hotels. A solid hotel visit but nothing spectacular.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location downtown Toronto. It's walking distance to many attractions, shopping and theatres. The valet parking is expensive ($45)! Some areas of the hotel feel a little dated, but otherwise the hotel is excellent. The service at check in was efficient and friendly. The hotel desk responded quickly to our requests for some maintenance in our room (completed while we went for dinner) and some wine glasses too. The breakfast buffet had a variety of hot and cold dishes. The carafe of coffee at our table was a nice touch too.  Overall, a very enjoyable stay!

reviews.title: Great location, exceptional service, good sized room.
reviews.text: Booked here for 5 nights, when arrived (after 8hr flight) Ben at reception could not of been any more friendlier or more welcoming. Quick checkin, Ben mentioned he had noticed we were there for 5 nights so allocated us a room with a little more space (seating area, sofa table etc). He also asked us what our plans were and gave us a city map with highlighted areas. A great touch. Room was a good size with fridge, tea coffee facilities, both beds very comfortable. Bathroom good size with tub and overhead shower. Location was excellent close to the village and also 15min walk from Eaton Centre also subway station very close. The only negative we had was the lack of housekeeping services, it transpired room only cleaned every 3rd night. No information either in room or at checkin to warn us of this. This due to (yes you guessed it!) COVID,  the cynic in me suggests its a cost saving exercise which the hotel trade has jumped onto as there is no reduction in room tariff for reduced services mmmmmmmm........... We did call down for fresh towels during our stay and they were delivered. This policy though did not dampen our overall high rating for this property I think because our first impressions and experience were so positive (shout out to Ben).

reviews.title: Conveniengt location with friendly supportive staff
reviews.text: Friendly staff, good food in the bistro. Welcoming lounge area in main foyer. Room was spacious and clean. Conveniently located in Downtown just ten minutes walk from Dundas Square. We had problem with leaky tap during our stay, having reported issue in morning the tap was still leaking on our return late that afternoon. We reported the issue again and maintenance arrived within five minuted to attend to it. On our return from our evening meal the tap was still leaking and water had been spilled in the main bedroom carpet. We had to change rooms as a result. Receptionist was very good in accomodating the move

reviews.title: nice basic hotel in decent location
reviews.text: room was clean, a/c worked well.  cable had lots of changes, water pressure good, window shaded blocked out sunlight.  needed towel by the door to block out that light and heard some hallway noise.  Sink was in the room and not in main bathroom, so maybe this room type better for one person (not sure what they called it) especially if one person wanted to sleep in.  Staff friendly, nice lobby area.  didnt eat at hotel.

reviews.title: Big thanks to Anurag Singh, Assistant Ops Manager!!!
reviews.text: I stayed at this location as I wanted to see some of Toronto before heading to another Marriott property near airport.The start of the trip was challenging as I had a flat tire with the rental car.  A few hours after arriving in Toronto I had made it to the CY.  I wasn't sure where the parking was so I had called the hotel and Anurag stayed on the phone with me till I arrived in front of the entrance.  I was fortunate that he kept one of the parking spaces for me!  As a single female traveling, it was very much appreciated to have parking on location.  Saturday night it was full and by Sunday afternoon, not many using the garage.Upon arriving, he gave me a snack bag, which was another treat!   I was famished sitting on the highway, waiting for emergency services!   I asked for dining recommendations that were walking distance and he provided me Hair of the Dog!  Delicious!!The room (#1118) faced an apartment building but not a big deal to me.  The couple nights I was there, the room worked for me.
